00022 enum {
00023     SYS_MAXBLKSIZE = 2048,  // a good number for a maximum signal vector size
00024     SYS_MAXSIGS = 250       // number of signal inlets you can have in an object
00025 };

00057 // macro loop for checking for NAN/INF
00058 
00059 // note: this may be platform-dependent
00060 
00061 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00062 
00063 #define NAN_MASK 0x7F800000
00064 
00065 #define NAN_CHECK(n,o) \
00066 while (--n) { if ((*++(o) & NAN_MASK) == NAN_MASK) *(o) = 0; }
00067 
00068 #define IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)      ((((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0)&&((v)!=0.f))
00069 #define IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)     ((((((unsigned long *)&(v))[0])&0x7fe00000)==0)&&((v)!=0.))         
00070 
00071 #define IS_NAN_FLOAT(v)         (((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0x7f800000)
00072 #define IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v)        (((((unsigned long *)&(v))[0])&0x7fe00000)==0x7fe00000) 
00073 
00074 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)      (IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)||IS_NAN_FLOAT(v))
00075 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)     (IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)||IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v))         
00076 
00077 #define FIX_DENORM_FLOAT(v)     
00078 #define FIX_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)    
00079 
00080 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)     
00081 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)
00082 
00083 #endif
00084 
00085 #ifdef WIN_VERSION
00086 
00087 #define NAN_MASK 0x7F800000
00088 
00089 #define NAN_CHECK(n,o) \
00090 while (--n) { if ((*++(o) & NAN_MASK) == NAN_MASK) *(o) = 0; }
00091 
00092 #define DENORM_WANT_FIX     1
00093 
00094 #define IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)      ((((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0)&&((v)!=0.f))
00095 #define IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)     ((((((unsigned long *)&(v))[1])&0x7fe00000)==0)&&((v)!=0.))         
00096 
00097 #define IS_NAN_FLOAT(v)         (((*(unsigned long *)&(v))&0x7f800000)==0x7f800000)
00098 #define IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v)        (((((unsigned long *)&(v))[1])&0x7fe00000)==0x7fe00000) 
00099 
00100 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)      (IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)||IS_NAN_FLOAT(v))
00101 #define IS_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)     (IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)||IS_NAN_DOUBLE(v))         
00102 
00103 #define FIX_DENORM_FLOAT(v)     ((v)=IS_DENORM_FLOAT(v)?0.f:(v))
00104 #define FIX_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)    ((v)=IS_DENORM_DOUBLE(v)?0.f:(v))
00105 
00106 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)     ((v)=IS_DENORM_NAN_FLOAT(v)?0.f:(v))
00107 #define FIX_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)    ((v)=IS_DENORM_NAN_DOUBLE(v)?0.:(v))
00108 
00109 #endif
00110 
00111 
00112 // header for all DSP objects. Provides a proxy.
00113 
00114 // z_misc flags:
00115 
00116 #define Z_NO_INPLACE 1          // flag indicating the object doesn't want signals in place
00117 #define Z_PUT_LAST 2            // when list of ugens is resorted, put this object at end
00118 #define Z_PUT_FIRST 4           // when list of ugens is resorted, put this object at beginning
00119 
00120 typedef void *t_proxy;
00121 
00122 typedef struct t_pxobject {
00123     struct object z_ob;
00124     long z_in;
00125     t_proxy *z_proxy;
00126     long z_disabled;
00127     short z_count;
00128     short z_misc;
00129 } t_pxobject;
00130 
00131 #ifdef __EXT_USER
00132 
00133 typedef struct t_pxbox {
00134     struct box z_box;
00135     long z_in;
00136     t_proxy *z_proxy;
00137     long z_disabled;
00138     short z_count;
00139     short z_misc;
00140 } t_pxbox;
00141 
00142 #else
00143 
00144 typedef void *t_pxbox;
00145 
00146 #endif
00147 
00148 // what is bound to the symbol "_conninfo"
00149 
00150 typedef struct t_conninfo {
00151     struct object *c_ob;
00152     long c_no;
00153 } t_conninfo;
00154 
00155 // the signal data structure
00156 
00157 #define MAXLOGSIG 13
00158 #define MAXSIGSIZE (1 << MAXLOGSIG)
00159 
00160 typedef struct _signal
00161 {
00162     long s_n;
00163     t_sample *s_vec;
00164     float s_sr;
00165     struct _signal *s_next;
00166     struct _signal *s_nextused;
00167     short s_refcount;
00168     short s_size;                   // element size (* s_n == memory)
00169     char *s_ptr;                    // what to free
00170 } t_signal;
00171 
00172 typedef struct _dspchain
00173 {
00174     t_object c_ob;
00175     t_int *c_chain;
00176     long c_chainsize;
00177     long c_callcount;
00178     long c_usedcount;
00179     long c_reusedcount;
00180     long c_freedcount;
00181     long c_sr;
00182     long c_bs;
00183     t_signal *c_usedlist;
00184     t_signal *c_freelist;
00185     t_signal *c_zero;
00186     struct _ugenbox *c_ugenlist;    // temporary variable, allows reentrant compiling
00187     struct _dspchain *c_prev;
00188     void *c_patcher;    // top-level parent or 0 if global
00189     void *c_inlets;     // collection of inlets
00190     void *c_outlets;    // collection of outlets
00191     t_signal *c_inputs;     // signal input list (zero before first exec)
00192     t_signal *c_outputs;    // signal output list
00193     // have to determine whether freelist is global or local
00194     long c_broken;      // object being freed, don't run it
00195 } t_dspchain;
00196

00198 
00199 typedef void *t_vptr;

00223 // access to DSP system variables
00224 
00225 int sys_getmaxblksize(void);    // returns current max blk size
00226 int sys_getblksize(void);       // returns current blk size
00227 float sys_getsr(void);          // returns current sampling rate
00228 int sys_getch(void);            // returns current number of channels
00229 
00230 int sys_optimize(void);         // returns whether to optimize or not
00231 int sys_altivec(void);          // returns whether machine has vector processing
00232 
00233 int sys_getdspstate(void);      // returns whether audio is on or off
00234

00238 void canvas_stop_dsp(void);
00239 void dsp_tick(void);            // no longer used
00240

00242

00244 t_dspchain *dspchain_get(void);
00245 t_dspchain *dspchain_compile(t_patcher *p, long bs, long sr);
00246 void dspchain_tick(t_dspchain *c);
00247 void canvas_start_onedsp(t_patcher *p, t_dspchain **c, long bs, long sr); 
00248 void canvas_stop_onedsp(t_dspchain *c);

00267 #define dsp_free z_dsp_free
00268

00273 #define dsp_sysinit z_sysinit

00279 #define dsp_freebox z_box_dsp_free
